content: I have a few places where I'd like to trigger a modal (e.g. a port I'm working on uses CTools modals, another module I'd like to do a modal popup from a contextual link) -- are there instructions anywhere on how to do modals with Backdrop without requiring Colorbox or a third-party?

Does this help? https://github.com/backdrop/backdrop-issues/issues/104

Backport Dialog API 路 Issue #104 路 backdrop/backdrop-issues
The WYSIWYG implementation in D8 is heavily dependent upon dialogs for uploading images, creating links, etc. The dialog API also can and should be used in our Views implementation, and in other pl...

I don't have any instructions, but my plan is to bring one of my custom D7 module to Backdrop. It's a field formatter called "Open in Modal", and will allow pages like this one https://wirtshaus-zur-brauerei.ch/offenausschank > instead of linking the teaser to another node (e.g. Detail page), it opens the same node in a modal. I am using custom themes only, but will try to make it as theme agnostic as possible.
